result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Bradley Huppert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle Bradley Huppert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle Bradley Huppert was found guilty of Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADA Walker advises of amounts due; $9,455 Restitution, $518 court costs.  Advises that a Petition and Order to Extend Supervision has been presented by Agent.  Defendant makes statement, questions restitution and other parties.  Court advises regarding joint/several restitution.  Court will extend Probation for two years and sign Order.
